column1: Eyes, ears, nose, and throat - Swelling of throat, lips, and mouth * Stomach and intestines - Abdominal cramping - Diarrhea - Nausea - Vomiting Heart and blood vessels - Severe decrease in blood pressure - Collapse* Lungs - Difficulty breathing * Skin - Hives * - Itching - Swelling and pain at site of sting
For severe reactions: Call 911 if the person has an allergic reaction (severe swelling or difficulty breathing).
If the person has only mild symptoms, give them the antihistamine medicine diphenhydramine (Benadryl) by mouth if they can swallow.

The person may also receive: - Blood and urine tests - Breathing support, including oxygen, tube through the mouth into the throat, and breathing machine - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Intravenous fluids (through a vein) - Medicines to treat symptoms
